query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 «S’io ti fiammeggio nel caldo d’amore 2 di là dal modo che ’n terra si vede, 3 sì che del viso tuo vinco il valore,
query.error: **English:** 1 "If I inflame you with the heat of love 2 beyond the way that is seen on earth, 3 so that I overcome the power of your sight,
query.result: 1 "Gif ic ðe ontende on ðæs lufan hætan 2 ofer ðone gecynd ðe on eorðan bið, 3 swa ðæt ðines ansynes wlite ic oferwinne,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 non ti maravigliar, ché ciò procede 5 da perfetto veder, che, come apprende, 6 così nel bene appreso move il piede.
query.error: **English:** 4 do not marvel, for this proceeds 5 from perfect seeing, which, as it apprehends, 6 so moves the foot in the good that is apprehended.
query.result: 4 ne wundrige ðe, forðæm ðis gæð 5 of fulfremedum gesyhðe, ðe, swa swa hit oncnæwð, 6 swa on ðam godan ðe hit oncnæwð hit stirað ðone fot.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Io veggio ben sì come già resplende 8 ne l’intelletto tuo l’etterna luce, 9 che, vista, sola e sempre amore accende;
query.error: **English:** 7 I see well how the eternal light 8 already shines in your intellect, 9 which, seen, alone and always kindles love;
query.result: 7 Ic geseo wel swa swa ðu ðæt ece leoht 8 on ðinum ðonce nu ðurhscineð, 9 ðæt ðu ðurh ða gesihðe ðone soðan lufa

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 e s’altra cosa vostro amor seduce, 11 non è se non di quella alcun vestigio, 12 mal conosciuto, che quivi traluce.
query.error: **English:** 10 and if something else seduces your love, 11 it is nothing but some trace of that, 12 poorly understood, which shines through here.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Tu vuo’ saper se con altro servigio, 14 per manco voto, si può render tanto 15 che l’anima sicuri di letigio».
query.error: **English:** 13 You want to know if with other service, 14 through a lesser vow, one can render so much 15 that the soul is assured of release from conflict».
query.result: 13 ðu woldest witan gif ðurh oðerne ðegnung, 14 ðurh læsse bebod, mæg beon swa micel 15 ðæt ðære sawle sy gescyld ðæs teonan».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Sì cominciò Beatrice questo canto; 17 e sì com’ uom che suo parlar non spezza, 18 continüò così ’l processo santo:
query.error: **English:** 16 Beatrice began this song; 17 and like one who does not break off his speech, 18 she continued the holy discourse thus:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 «Lo maggior don che Dio per sua larghezza 20 fesse creando, e a la sua bontate 21 più conformato, e quel ch’e’ più apprezza,
query.error: **English:** 19 "The greatest gift that God in his generosity 20 made in creating, and to his goodness 21 most conformed, and that which he most highly values,
query.result: 19 "Se mæsta gifu ðe God ðurh his mildheortnysse 20 geworhte ða he gesceop, and to his godnysse 21 mæst gelic, and ðæt ðe he mæst lufað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 fu de la volontà la libertate; 23 di che le creature intelligenti, 24 e tutte e sole, fuoro e son dotate.
query.error: **English:** 22 was the freedom of the will; 23 with which intelligent creatures, 24 both all and each, were and are endowed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Or ti parrà, se tu quinci argomenti, 26 l’alto valor del voto, s’è sì fatto 27 che Dio consenta quando tu consenti;
query.error: **English:** 25 Now it will seem to you, if you reason from this, 26 the high value of the vow, if it is so made 27 that God consents when you consent;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 ché, nel fermar tra Dio e l’omo il patto, 29 vittima fassi di questo tesoro, 30 tal quale io dico; e fassi col suo atto.
query.error: **English:** 28 because, in establishing the pact between God and man, 29 one makes a victim of this treasure, 30 just as I say; and one does so with one's own act.
query.result: 28 forðæm ðe on ðam fæstnigenge ðæs forewearde betwux Gode and men, 29 man wyrðð þises goldhordes lac, 30 swylce ic secge; and wyrðð ðurh his agen dæd.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Dunque che render puossi per ristoro? 32 Se credi bene usar quel c’hai offerto, 33 di maltolletto vuo’ far buon lavoro.
query.error: **English:** 31 So what can be given in return? 32 If you truly believe you can use what has been offered, 33 you will make good work from bad material.
query.result: 31 Hwat mæg ðonne beon for edlean? 32 Gif ðu ðæt wel brucan woldest, 33 ðu miht of lytlum wel geweorðan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Tu se’ omai del maggior punto certo; 35 ma perché Santa Chiesa in ciò dispensa, 36 che par contra lo ver ch’i’ t’ho scoverto,
query.error: **English:** 34 You are certainly at the highest point; 35 but why does Holy Church grant a dispensation in this, 36 which seems contrary to the truth that I have revealed to you,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 convienti ancor sedere un poco a mensa, 38 però che ’l cibo rigido c’hai preso, 39 richiede ancora aiuto a tua dispensa.
query.error: **English:** 37 you must still sit down to eat for a while, 38 because the hard food that you have taken 39 still requires help from your pantry.
query.result: 37 ðe gedafenað ðæt ðu sitte ða hwile æt þære mæðle, 38 forðæm ðe se hearda mete ðe ðu ðær næme, 39 ðearf ðinre helpe ðe ðu ðær hæfst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Apri la mente a quel ch’io ti paleso 41 e fermalvi entro; ché non fa scïenza, 42 sanza lo ritenere, avere inteso.
query.error: **English:** 40 Open your mind to what I reveal to you 41 and fix it within; for without retaining it, 42 having understood is not knowledge.
query.result: 40 Onlŷs ðone mōd ðe ic ðe mǣne 41 and fæst ðær on; forðæm ðe nāt ðæt cunnan, 42 būtan ðām gehealde, hæfð gehŷred.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Due cose si convegnono a l’essenza 44 di questo sacrificio: l’una è quella 45 di che si fa; l’altr’ è la convenenza.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Two things are appropriate to the essence 44 of this sacrifice: one is that 45 of which it is made; the other is the agreement.
**Old English:**
43 Twegen ðing gebyriað ðæs offrunges 44 gesceaft: ān is ðæt 45 ðæs ðe hē is geworht; ðæt ōðer is ðæt geþing.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Quest’ ultima già mai non si cancella 47 se non servata; e intorno di lei 48 sì preciso di sopra si favella:
query.error: **English:** 46 This last one is never cancelled 47 unless it is observed; and concerning it 48 such precise discourse is made above:
query.result: 46 Þeos ytemeste næfre ne awent, 47 buton heo gehealden wære; and embe heo 48 swylc riht ræd bufan is gesæd:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 però necessitato fu a li Ebrei 50 pur l’offerere, ancor ch’alcuna offerta 51 sì permutasse, come saver dei.
query.error: **English:** 49 therefore it was necessary for the Hebrews 50 simply to offer it, although some offerings 51 were changed, as you shall know.
query.result: 49 þurh ðæt wæs nied Hebräum 50 ðæt heo hit offrian sceolden, þeah ðe ænig lac 51 awende wære, swa ðu witan scealt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 L’altra, che per materia t’è aperta, 53 puote ben esser tal, che non si falla 54 se con altra materia si converta.
query.error: **English:** 52 The other, which is open to you through experience, 53 can very well be such that it does not fail 54 if it is converted with another experience.
query.result: 52 Seo oðer, ðe ðe ðurh andgit bið onlocen, 53 mæg wel beon swylc, ðæt hit ne awent 54 gif hit bið mid oðrum andgite awend.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Ma non trasmuti carco a la sua spalla 56 per suo arbitrio alcun, sanza la volta 57 e de la chiave bianca e de la gialla;
query.error: **English:** 55 But no one can change his burden to his shoulder 56 of his own free will, without the turning 57 and the white and yellow key;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 e ogne permutanza credi stolta, 59 se la cosa dimessa in la sorpresa 60 come ’l quattro nel sei non è raccolta.
query.error: **English:** 58 and every change you believe is foolish, 59 if the thing laid down in the surprise 60 is not gathered up like the four in the six.
query.result: 58 and ælc ymbhwærf du wenst ðæt hit sie unspedig, 59 gif ðæt ðing ðe wæs on ðære færunge gelæded 60 nis on ðam sexe swa swa ðæt feower gegaderod.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Però qualunque cosa tanto pesa 62 per suo valor che tragga ogne bilancia, 63 sodisfar non si può con altra spesa.
query.error: **English:** 61 Therefore, whatever thing weighs so much 62 by its value that it outweighs every scale, 63 cannot be satisfied with any other expense.
query.result: 61 Forðæm nænig ðing swa hefig nis 62 ðurh his agen ðæt ænig wæg oferwegan mæg, 63 ðæt hit mid nanum oðrum gesceafte forgolden weorðan mæg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 cui più si convenia dicer ‘Mal feci’, 68 che, servando, far peggio; e così stolto 69 ritrovar puoi il gran duca de’ Greci,
query.error: **English:** 67 it would have been better for him to say, "I did wrong," 68 than to do worse by keeping his vow; and just as foolish 69 you may find the great leader of the Greeks,
query.result: 67 ðam wæs betere ðæt he cwæde, "Ic yfele dyde," 68 ðonne ðæt he wyrse dyde, ða ða he ðæt geheold; and ðus dysigle 69 ðu miht ðone mæran heretogan ðara Greca findan,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 onde pianse Efigènia il suo bel volto, 71 e fé pianger di sé i folli e i savi 72 ch’udir parlar di così fatto cólto.
query.error: **English:** 70 because of whom Iphigenia wept her beautiful face, 71 and made both the wise and the foolish weep for her 72 when they heard tell of such a cruel sacrifice.
query.result: 70 ðurh ðone Efigenia beweop hire fægre andwlito, 71 and dyde wepan be hire ða wisan and ða dysigan 72 ða ðe ðæs swiðan heardan hlotes gehyrdon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Siate, Cristiani, a muovervi più gravi: 74 non siate come penna ad ogne vento, 75 e non crediate ch’ogne acqua vi lavi.
query.error: **English:** 73 Be more steadfast, Christians, in your actions: 74 do not be like a feather in every wind, 75 and do not believe that every water will wash you clean.
query.result: 73 Beoð, Cristne men, on eowrum mode swiðre: 74 ne beoð na swa swa fiðer on ælcne wind, 75 and ne gelyfe ðe ðæt ælc wæter eow þwea.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Avete il novo e ’l vecchio Testamento, 77 e ’l pastor de la Chiesa che vi guida; 78 questo vi basti a vostro salvamento.
query.error: **English:** 76 You have the New and the Old Testament, 77 and the shepherd of the Church who guides you; 78 this should suffice for your salvation.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Se mala cupidigia altro vi grida, 80 uomini siate, e non pecore matte, 81 sì che ’l Giudeo di voi tra voi non rida!
query.error: **English:** 79 If evil greed cries out something else to you, 80 be men, and not senseless sheep, 81 so that the Jew will not laugh at you among yourselves!
query.result: 79 Gif yfel gitsung iu oðer hlyneð, 80 beoð men and na unwisra sceapa, 81 ðæt se Iudea ne hlihhe on eow betwux!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Non fate com’ agnel che lascia il latte 83 de la sua madre, e semplice e lascivo 84 seco medesmo a suo piacer combatte!».
query.error: **English:** 82 Do not act like a lamb that leaves the milk 83 of its mother, and simple and wanton 84 fights with itself at its own pleasure.”
query.result: 82 Ne doð swa ðæt lomb ðe læteð ðone 83 meolc his modor, and unwis and wac 84 wið hine sylfne on his willan winneð!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Così Beatrice a me com’ ïo scrivo; 86 poi si rivolse tutta disïante 87 a quella parte ove ’l mondo è più vivo.
query.error: **English:** 85 Thus Beatrice spoke to me as I write; 86 then she turned, full of longing, 87 to that part where the world is most alive.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Lo suo tacere e ’l trasmutar sembiante 89 puoser silenzio al mio cupido ingegno, 90 che già nuove questioni avea davante;
query.error: **English:** 88 His silence and the changing of his countenance 89 silenced my eager mind, 90 which already had new questions before it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 e sì come saetta che nel segno 92 percuote pria che sia la corda queta, 93 così corremmo nel secondo regno.
query.error: **English:** 91 and just as an arrow that strikes the target 92 before the bowstring is still, 93 so we raced into the second realm.
query.result: 91 and swa swa stræl ðe ðurh ðone stefn flit, 92 ðurh ðone sweg ðæs bogan, ær ðe ðæt wund sie, 93 swa ðurh ðone sweg ðæs windes ða we ðurh ðone weg flugon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Quivi la donna mia vid’ io sì lieta, 95 come nel lume di quel ciel si mise, 96 che più lucente se ne fé ’l pianeta.
query.error: **English:** 94 There I saw my lady so joyful, 95 as she entered the light of that heaven, 96 that the planet became more radiant.
query.result: 94 Þær ic ða ðone fægeran geseah, 95 swa swa heo on ðæs heofonlican leohtes gefean eode, 96 ðæt ðæs tungles beorhtost wearð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 E se la stella si cambiò e rise, 98 qual mi fec’ io che pur da mia natura 99 trasmutabile son per tutte guise!
query.error: **English:** 97 And if the star changed and laughed, 98 what did I do, who am by my nature 99 changeable in every way!
query.result: 97 And gif ðeos steorra his hiw forgeaf and hloh, 98 hwæt dyde ic ða ðe eom of gecynde 99 on æghwylce wisan wrixendlic!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Come ’n peschiera ch’è tranquilla e pura 101 traggonsi i pesci a ciò che vien di fori 102 per modo che lo stimin lor pastura,
query.error: **English:** 100 As in a fishpond that is tranquil and pure 101 the fish are drawn to what comes from outside 102 so that they think it is their food,
query.result: 100 Swa swa on mere ðe bið milde and smylt 101 fiscas tiohoð to ðam ðe of ufele cymeð 102 ðurh ðæt ðe hi wenað ðæt hit hi sylfe mete sy,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 sì vid’ io ben più di mille splendori 104 trarsi ver’ noi, e in ciascun s’udia: 105 «Ecco chi crescerà li nostri amori».
query.error: **English:** 103 so I saw well more than a thousand splendors 104 drawn towards us, and in each one could be heard: 105 "Behold, one who will increase our love".
query.result: 103 swa ic ða geseah ðusenda mo 104 beorhtra gesceafta to usweard teon 105 and on æghwylcum ðus cwæðan ic gehyrde:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 E sì come ciascuno a noi venìa, 107 vedeasi l’ombra piena di letizia 108 nel folgór chiaro che di lei uscia.
query.error: **English:** 106 And just as each one came towards us, 107 we could see the shade full of joy 108 in the bright radiance that issued from it.
query.result: 106 And swa swa ælc tō ūs cōm, 107 wæs ðæs sceаdu ful ðæs gefēan, 108 on ðæm beorhtan lēoman ðe of him lēohte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Pensa, lettor, se quel che qui s’inizia 110 non procedesse, come tu avresti 111 di più savere angosciosa carizia;
query.error: **English:** 109 Think, reader, if that which is begun here 110 did not proceed, how you would have 111 a more anxious craving for knowledge;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 e per te vederai come da questi 113 m’era in disio d’udir lor condizioni, 114 sì come a li occhi mi fur manifesti.
query.error: **English:** 112 and for yourself you will see how from these 113 I was eager to hear their state, 114 just as they were made manifest to my eyes.
query.result: 112 and ðu ðurh ðe selfne gesihst hu me fram ðissum 113 wæs wilnung ðara ðinga ðe hi ðrowiað, 114 swa swa hi ðurh ða eagan me geswutelode wæron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 «O bene nato a cui veder li troni 116 del trïunfo etternal concede grazia 117 prima che la milizia s’abbandoni,
query.error: **English:** 115 "O blessed one to whom grace grants 116 to see the thrones of the eternal triumph 117 before the army disbands,
query.result: 115 "Eala ðu wel geboren ðe ðam ðe ða tronum 116 ðæs ecan ðriumphes geseon forgeaf miltse 117 ærðam ðe ðæt werod todræfe,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 del lume che per tutto il ciel si spazia 119 noi semo accesi; e però, se disii 120 di noi chiarirti, a tuo piacer ti sazia».
query.error: **English:** 118 we are kindled by the light that spreads through all of heaven; 119 and therefore, if you desire 120 to learn about us, satisfy yourself at your pleasure."
query.result: 118 ðæs leohtes ðe ðurh ealne ðone heofon spryt 119 we synd ontende; and forðy, gif ðu gewilnast 120 be us to gecnawanne, ðinne willan ðu gefylle."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Così da un di quelli spirti pii 122 detto mi fu; e da Beatrice: «Dì, dì 123 sicuramente, e credi come a dii».
query.error: **English:** 121 Thus by one of those spirits of piety 122 it was said to me; and by Beatrice: "Say, say 123 confidently, and believe as if to a god."
query.result: 121 Þus fram anum ðara gasta goda 122 me wæs gecweden; and fram Beatričan: "Secge, secge 123 trymlice, and gelyf swa swa Gode."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 «Io veggio ben sì come tu t’annidi 125 nel proprio lume, e che de li occhi il traggi, 126 perch’ e’ corusca sì come tu ridi;
query.error: **English:** 124 "I see well how you nest 125 in your own light, and that you draw it from your eyes, 126 because it sparkles as you smile;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 ma non so chi tu se’, né perché aggi, 128 anima degna, il grado de la spera 129 che si vela a’ mortai con altrui raggi».
query.error: **English:** 127 but I do not know who you are, nor why you have, 128 worthy soul, the rank of the sphere 129 that veils itself from mortals with other rays."
query.result: 127 ac ic nat hwæt ðu eart, ne for hwi ðu hæfst, 128 ðu wyrðe sawl, ðone grad ðære speore 129 ðe ðus ðe bewrigenð fram ðæm deadlicum mid oðerra leohta."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Questo diss’ io diritto a la lumera 131 che pria m’avea parlato; ond’ ella fessi 132 lucente più assai di quel ch’ell’ era.
query.error: **English:** 130 This I said directly to the light 131 that had spoken to me before; whereupon it became 132 more radiant than it had been.
query.result: 130 Þis ic sæde rihte to ðære leohte 131 ðe ær to me spræc; ða heo wearð fægerre 132 micle ðonne heo ær wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Sì come il sol che si cela elli stessi 134 per troppa luce, come ’l caldo ha róse 135 le temperanze d’i vapori spessi,
query.error: **English:** 133 Just as the sun conceals itself in its own light, 134 because of too much light, just as the heat has dispersed 135 the moderation of the dense vapors,
query.result: 133 Swa swa ðone sunne ðe ðe selfne hylð 134 ðurh ða miclan leoht, swa ða hætan forbærnð 135 ðara ðiccena wæta gemetgunga,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 per più letizia sì mi si nascose 137 dentro al suo raggio la figura santa; 138 e così chiusa chiusa mi rispuose
query.error: **English:** 136 because of more joy, so the holy figure hid itself from me 137 within its own radiance; 138 and thus, completely hidden, it answered me

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 nel modo che ’l seguente canto canta.
query.error: **English:** 139 in the manner that the following canto sings.
query.result: 139 on ða wisan ðe ðeos æfterra sang singð.
